textos.¿Quieres continuar?: If you continue, you will leave the game and go to the project page. Do you want to continue?
textos.Ataque potenciado_desc: Your attack will do more damage, but it will also consume more energy
textos.Bala acelerada_desc: Your magical projectiles will move faster
textos.Aura ampliada_desc: You can store more energy for when you need it
textos.Absorber energía ambiental_desc: You will recover more energy from the environment every second
textos.Atraer partículas_desc: You will attract the energy particles released by the enemies
textos.Ataque seguidor_desc: Your attack will be more likely to hit the enemy
textos.Curación potenciada_desc: Your healing spell will heal faster by spending the same energy
textos.Curación en grupo_desc: Your healing spell will heal all the members of the group with the same energy
textos.Escudo en grupo_desc: Your shield spell will protect all group members with the same energy
textos.Escudo potenciado_desc: Your shield spell will last longer with the same energy expenditure
textos.Hechizo de curar_desc: You can heal the members of your group with this spell
textos.Hechizo de escudo_desc: You can protect the members of your group with this spell

preguntas.s: I want to be with you.
preguntas.r: あなたと一緒にいたいです。
o: I want to go with you.

inicio.text: You are traveling to a new world.
Towards a light that draws you in ...
Towards a voice that calls you ...
And you know the adventure has begun.

inicio.t: Thanks for coming. I suppose I owe you an explanation: I have summoned you because I need your help.
My name is Nami Kitsune and I am the librarian of the School of Magical Creatures.
These are the undergrounds of the school. A book called "Mahou no kotoba" has been lost somewhere around here. That book can change everything.
I also believe that there are students looking for it. I fear for their safety.
I will give you more details later, but now it is important that we hurry.
I need you to guide me through these corridors and help me if there is any danger.
First of all let's take a look at the furniture in this room. I feel there is magic nearby.

Escaleras arriba.t: Those stairs take you back to the school.
I can show you the school later if you want, but we don't have time right now.

Armario roto.t: A page of the book! This was what I felt.
But why is the book losing pages? Something strange is happeneing.
The good thing though, is that you can learn magic from the pages.
For example, this one can teach you to fly faster. I advise you to learn that one as soon as possible.

primeraSubida.t: When leveling up you can choose a new skill. Choose wisely.
Find for a skill that interests you from the page on the right. Click on it and then click on the improve button.

Habla del libro.t: Another page! This one talks about how to collect energy from the environment.
This knowledge will be very useful for you. This place is full of energy, and you'll need it to cast spells.
However I'm still worried that the book is losing pages. I wonder why.
Maybe it is leaving them for some reason, or it is creating new ones and it needs space.

Nami lejos.t: You cannot examine the objects without Nami's help, wait for her to approach.

mensajeEsperame.t: Hey, wait for me, please! I cannot go as fast as you.
And if I lose sight of you I will not be able to follow you.

sinEnergía.t: You lack energy to do magic, right? I could lend you something of mine.
Get close to me if you want it and I'll transfer it to you.

a.t: All right, let me concentrate.
Mmmmmm.
You feel the energy fill you, and you regain your full potential.
But Nami falls to her knees, exhausted.
Don't worry, I'm fine. But I don't think I can help you much more with this.
All right. You can passively recover energy from the environment just by waiting.

sinEnergía.t: In any case there are techniques that can help you recover energy faster. I advise you to study them as soon as possible.

vesPrimerEnemigo.t: Watch out! That blue mass that moves is a toxic slime.
I can't get close or it will poison me, but you can get rid of it by using your magic.
Just click on the slime to throw a ball of energy.

eliminasPrimerEnemigo.t: Good job! You've got rid of the slime.
It should have released the spiritual energy that sustained it.
I can't see it, but if you can, pick it up. You will need it.
You will have spent energy casting spells, so it will be good to replenish it.

Frasco inicial.t: These flasks must contain alchemical products.
That could be the origin of the slimes we have seen.
The power of the book must have infused them with spiritual energy, giving them life.

Armario laboratorio.t: Hmmm ... It says here about how to launch your energy attacks more quickly.
It may be tempting to take on the monsters quicker, but be careful.
Make sure you have enough energy, or it won't do you any good to shoot quickly.

Mesa experimentos.t: Wow, this looks like it was some kind of alchemical equipment.
This floor must be some kind of laboratory.
In case you're interested, these undergrounds belonged to a civilization now vanished.
Of course we don't like to live underground, so we do not use them.

Estantería laboratorio.t: A work on the aura ... you definitely should read this one.
The aura can be defined as the magical form of our body.
In your case the aura is your whole body, because you do not have the physical part.
Expanding your aura can help you retain more magic for when you need it.

then.t: Now that there seems to be no danger, I want to thank you for what you are doing.
I know that, given the circumstance, it is difficult for me to get to know you, since we can't even speak. But I think you must be a great person.
When we invoke spirits from other planes, they usually ask us for something in return. You, on the other hand, help without any demands.
I want you to know that when this is over I will look for a way to help you too.
Eh ... It seems that something is moving over there.
Oh no! It's another one of those slimes!
It seems that this was a warehouse. It is all full of alchemical products.
I'm afraid we'll find more toxic slime on this floor.

else.t: More alchemical products. I wonder what they would use them for.

Mesa almacén.t: Here it talks about how to enhance magic attacks.
Be careful with this too, because enhancing the attacks will cost more energy.
You can also learn spells that help you recover energy.

Nada.t: Doesn't seem to be anything interesting here.

then.t: These must have been the Ancients who created this underground.
It's hard to tell what they looked like from these statues, but I have seen illustrations of them.
What we don't know is what their society was like.
They supposedly dominated a very powerful magic. It scares me a little, in fact.
But the most mysterious thing about them is their disappearance. Its cause is unknown.

else.t: Another statue like the other one. Either they were very similar, or they must have been important.

then.t: This seems to have been a library, although there's no books left.
They were probably alchemical books for laboratories.
They might have disintegrated over time, after all it has been centuries since the disappearance of the Ancients.
The Ancients had the ability to make better books with their magic, but most were normal books.
By the way, the book we are looking for is one of those magical books that the Ancients created.

else.t: It makes me sad to see a library without books.

Estantería biblioteca.t: Another page on how to improve movement in flight ...
What's happening? We are finding so many pages.
Don't think the book is defective. On the contrary, it is doing it on purpose.
That book belonged to great sorceresses of the past, and ended up acquiring its own conscience.
I would bet it has a purpose of its own.

Mesa biblioteca.t: Oh I see. A page on how to accelerate magical projectiles.
Very useful, especially when you fight from a distance.
I remember when I learned this technique. It isn't easy to master.
Although honestly, you are doing quite well. Magic seems to come natural for you.

Mesa animales.t: Let me see ... This chapter talks about how to attract energy particles.
Like those that come out of the slimes when they are eliminated.
The energy stays concentrated for only a few seconds, then it disperses and cannot be recovered.
That's why this kind of techniques can be very useful.
But it's only useful for spirits. The corporeal beings do not have the possibility of using them.
I had never thought about it, but this book has a lot of information that magicians can not use.

then.t: Wow! This looks like cages.
I just had a chill. They were probably for animals used in experiments.
Apparently, the Ancients could be quite cruel, sadistic even.
But I do not think they were all like that.
We know so very little about their culture.

else.t: I don't even want to think about what would happen to the animals that were here.

Objeto inesperado.t: There is something here! It looks like a gem.
We use gems to store spiritual energy, so perhaps this is from one of the students who went down.
In fact I feel that I've seen it before, but I don't remember whose it was.
Poor dears, they probably believe that they are to blame for what is happening with the book.
The truth is that the book has a will of its own, and what it is doing must have another reason.
In any case I will take the gem, we might need it later.

Relieve.t: This looks like inscriptions in the Ancients language.
I do not know how to read it very well, but I can decipher some of its words.
It seems as if they celebrated a victory, although I do not know against whom.
Against other Ancients perhaps? In theory, the magical creatures didn't even know us.
And when they took refuge underground, they moved further away from us.
Thanks be given that we were not affected by their annihilating magic.

Mesa operaciones.t: This looks like an infirmary ... or something like that.
And here is another page that ... seems interesting.
It contains the healing spell! I advise you to learn this quickly.
It's funny that the book has left this page right here. I guess it fits with their way of thinking.
The book doesn't understand things as a person, but it tries to mimic behaviors.

Curame.t: Now that you know the healing spell, could you heal me?
Being hurt makes things worse and I walk more slowly.
And I don't want to waste my own energy because I can't recover it as easily as you do.
Can you see the blue star above you?
If you touch it, a red heart will appear.
Touch that heart and then me to cast the spell.
That's how they told me that magic works for you, although I do not understand why.

then.t: I wonder what kind of people occupied these beds.
I want to believe that they would be magicians who suffered accidents doing experiments, but ...
I've read too many weird things about the Ancients ...
Although I suppose we cannot judge other cultures from our perspective.

else.t: If these were beds, they sure aren't very comfortable.
Our beds are all magically enchanted to be perfect.
Of course, the Ancients might not have been able to do that.
Although they knew more about magic than us, they were not magical creatures themselves.

Aura2.t: The aura is something curious. Not being able to see it makes it difficult to control.
To my knowledge, in your world the aura is not known, right?
I wonder who would discover it in ours.

Alquimia avanzada.t: I have always had the feeling that the Ancients had enormously advanced alchemy.
Magical creatures use our own magic more.
Many times I wonder if the origin of the magic of the Ancients is different from ours.

Armario curación potenciada.t: Hey! This explains how to improve your healing.
This technique is very useful because it does not increase the energy cost of the spell.
That is, you can heal us more with the same effort.

Más sobre recoger.t: More information on capturing environmental energy. It will be useful.
But I keep wondering why the book is losing so many pages.
The headmistress of the school has been using it all these days without any problem, precisely trying to connect with your world.
I find it hard to believe, knowing her abilities. But with these old books you never know.
Even for the Ancients it had to be one of their oldest books.

then.t: This table looks like a desk, it's full of ink stains.
Maybe they stored the results of their experiments here. Or maybe it was a teaching classroom.
What a pity that we have hardly any information about their investigations.
Although as far as we know, some of them would not be to our liking.

else.t: Here is something written. I think it says... Eh... I better not read it. It's just a joke in bad taste.
Wow! I always imagine the Ancients as people so serious and majestic that I forget they were people like us.
It couldn't be easy for them to have to come and take refuge here, in the underground.
But of course, it is also true that it was they who made the surface uninhabitable.

Estantería scriptorium.t: Nothing has been saved from their documents. Now they are just dust.
I wonder what happened to the Ancients. Where would they go?
Magical creatures and the Ancients coexisted in the past, but we hid from them.
I do not know the reason, really. It was many years ago, and the origin of the problem hasn't come down to us.

Ataque seguidor.t: Ah ... A page on how to make attacks follow a target.
It is an exceptionally complex magic, but it guarantees that you will never miss.
It requires introducing into the sphere of energy the capacity to perceive its destiny.

Armario de pasillo.t: More information on how to increase the power of your attacks. It is an endless theme.
I know sorceresses capable of destroying a whole mountain with a single energy ball.
Of course, that is not very useful, actually.

then.t: Before continuing ... I wanted to ask you something.
I can try to use telepathy to communicate with you, but I do not want to do it without your permission.
Let's do this, if you agree, come close to me, and if not, get away from me. What do you think?

a.t: Okay, let me concentrate.
Mmmmmm.
Nothing, I'm sorry, I only catch unconnected thoughts, and I can not understand them at all.
It happens sometimes, spiritual minds are hard to read.
Okay, I respect your decision.

then.t: At least we have found a way that you can tell me yes or no.
Taking advantage of that, I wanted to ask you something. Would you like to come to our school in the future?
I know that in your world you are not a magical creature, but here you would be, so you could study in our school.

a.t: Great! I would like to meet you in person.
Our headmistress is working on it, along with the queen of the fairies of your world.
If you finally come here I assure you it will be very fun.
Oh, well I hope I can find another way to thank you.
You're really helping me a lot.

Cristal.t: Look! This is a soul crystal. A living crystal.
These crystals are what give life to the school.
Being alive, they can store memories.
Maybe with a spell I can see what happened here.
It seems that they are looking for the book.
I'm glad Mei is here, Hikari is a freshman and may be in danger, but Mei ... is special.
The important thing is that we are on the right track.

Escaleras2.t: I don't detect the energy from the book around here.
I don't think they have taken this path, we must continue searching.

Mesa escudo.t: With this you can protect us from damage, but be careful, it consumes a lot of energy.

Acelerar en cama.t: I never knew of these techniques to improve the flight.
It's true, though, that I have not trained that kind of magic too much.
In your world you have machines to do these things, right?

a.t: I thought that. The truth is that I don't know much about your world, but the headmistress has compiled a lot of information.
I wonder what it would be like to fly on a machine. We can only fly with animals or magic.
Except those who have wings, like fairies, of course.
Although none of these ways of flying is too safe, actually.
Oh, I must have misunderstood something. We have so little knowledge about your world.
Only a few months ago the headmistress managed to contact it.

Jaula guardian.t: How strange, there is a bed and here is a cage.
If someone was sleeping here, why is there also a place to enclose an animal?
It could be for a pet, but if so, why lock it?

Curar en grupo.t: Phew, thank Inari that the page has not been stained with the alchemical products. It is very interesting
It talks about how to emit a wave of healing energy that heals a whole group of people.
The best part is that it does not need extra energy, and allows everyone to be healed quickly.

Tarros laboratorio.t: I am not sure that these jars and instruments are made of glass.
I would bet that it is some unknown material, created by the Ancients.
It is a civilization that at the same time amazes me and scares me.

Mesa laboratorio arriba.t: If I knew more about alchemy I might guess what they were doing here.
I think I lock myself up too much in the library with my books. I should practice magic more often.
It seems to me that the last month I spent more time inside the library than outside of it.
Although much of that time has been spent learning your language.
It would have been impossible without the magic of the Fairy Queen of your world.

Gran puerta.t: Well, it's closed. And these are protections of the Ancients.
Maybe it's a measure of protection against the presence of monsters.
It's forgotten magic, and too powerful. I wouldn't know how to undo it.
There must be another way to open the door, or disable the protections.

then.t: This looks like a bedroom.
It is likely that many of the alchemists lived here.
Or maybe it was a kind of alchemist school, and the students lived here.

else.t: I'm still thinking how hard it had to be to come and live here inside.
Millions of beings having to leave the surface forever, unable to see the light of the sun again.
What would lead them to cause such a destruction, and what harmed them so much?

Encuentra escudo potenciado.t: Aquí hay otra. Esta habla de cómo hacer escudos que duren más.
Al alargar la vida del escudo su coste aumenta un poco, pero sinceramente creo que merece la pena.

Segundo dormitorio.t: It is curious that this furniture has been preserved down here for so long.
It looks like wood, but they could not get it from the surface. Maybe some kind of underground plant.
Or maybe it's some other material that they invented.

Oración.t: Here it talks about the values of the Ancients. It is a kind of prayer.
It's funny, it seems that the Ancients were very similar to each other, unlike magical creatures.
As far as I know, in your world you are also very diverse, although you do not always consider yourself magical creatures.

a.t: I'm sorry that we can't communicate better, I would like to know what kind of creature you are.
Yes, I have heard that there are people who do not recognize themselves as magical creatures in your world.
Many people are completely unaware of their existence.
Ah ... you may not really know. In your world they don't teach you about it, as far as I know.
But, being sincere, if you have doubts it is possible that you are one. If you were not, you would not hesitate.
When you have been educated to not believe in something that you are, it is difficult to accept the reality.

Oración.t: In any case I know that in your world many kinds of people coexist in many ways.
I love that kind of diversity, even if I don't understand it.

Armario bala.t: After a fight like that, I find it even more interesting.

Escudo en grupo.t: It makes the shield protect the whole group, instead of just one person.
With these techniques the slimes will only be a minor annoyance.

then.t: I'm going to talk to this person. I think I've never seen them before.
あなたは大丈夫ですか？
はい。
あなたの名前は何ですか？
花です。
She says her name is Hana, but I don't know her.
Nor does she wear the school uniform.
どうやってここに来ましたか？
私は知らない。
私たちと一緒に来てください。
はい。
She does not seem very talkative, maybe she's scared.
I told her to come with us. Please, take care that nothing happens to her.

Hana encuentra una hoja.t: 花、本を知っていますか？
How strange, Hana has found a page and it looks like she recognizes it...
She even says she knows the book.
How is that possible? Almost nobody has access to that book, and she doesn't look like a student at this school.
Maybe she has entered into the reserved wing with Hikari and Mei, but how could she enter the school in the first place?

Curación potenciada 2.t: Again, these techniques do not increase the energy needed to cast the spell, so they are quite useful.

Suposiciones Hana.t: When I saw these chemical products, I had a funny thought...
Do not take me too seriously, but ... what if Hana is a product of this lab?
She could also be heir of the Ancients. There is nothing left of them, but some of their creations have been found alive.
The thing is that I don't recognize her as any kind of magical creature. I do not know if you want me to continue annoying you with my hypothesis ...

a.t: Okay. Obviously she isn't a fairy, nor a wolf girl, nor a vampire.
If she were a dragon, angel or similar, she would have capacity to hide it, but she doesn't seem to have that much power.
And witches are easily distinguished by their smell. At least I can; I have a good nose.
It is also true that there are countless magical creatures, and that I can't know them all, but ...
I don't know, there are too many unusual circumstances surrounding this girl.
Sometimes I think out-loud too much.

Último ataque potente.t: Another page on how to improve your attack.
This seems excessive to me. Is force the only way to solve things?

Escudo potenciado 2.t: This could be useful. Eliminating the slimes is fine, but avoiding them is an option too.
With the shield to the maximum perhaps we could run between them without problems.
Although on the other hand it is necessary to search everywhere, we should not leave any page forgotten.

Estatua fundador.t: I do not understand it well, but I think it's about the founder of these laboratories, or something like that.
It indicates the date on which they were founded. Although I'm not sure, I think it's a few decades before the disappearance of the Ancients.
We never got to know what happened. They did not venture to the surface, and we did not go down to their subways.
We believed for years that they were still down here, until their machines on the surface began to fail. Nobody fixed them.
Then we started to explore the subways, and discovered that they were completely empty.
Some say they made a journey, but where?

colector.t: Wow! This seems to be an accumulator of spiritual energy of the Ancients.
It's strange, It should be completely exhausted ...
Perhaps the presence of the book's pages is generating energy. That is why we must recover them all.
In fact it would be good also to empty this accumulator.

then.t: It may be what has blocked the door. If we empty it, we can move on.

else.t: It may be activating unknown artifacts of this level. I think it would be better to empty it.

colector.t: I do not fully understand this technology, but I think I know how to do it.
What it contains is spiritual energy. You can absorb it if you get into the sphere.

a.t: Oh, do not worry, It shouldn't hurt you.
In the worst case you would return to your plane and I could re-invoke you.
Okay, I will simply try to release the energy.
放す。
You feel as if an energy wave were going through the whole room.
Wow! I expected it to have dissipated, but it seems that the energy remains here.
If so, I fear that it may have affected other creatures.

then.t: As soon as you enter the sphere you feel a powerful energy flooding over you.
You note something strange ...
Oh! You have changed!
The influence of the book is greater than I expected. The energy that you have absorbed wasn't neutral.
It shouldn't be a problem, but I'll be careful if something happens.

Cristal2.t: Another crystal! I will cast the spell again.
私はあなたと一緒にいたいです。
It seems that Mei is aware of the danger, but Hikari does not want to leave her alone.
Hikari is too inexperienced, she would be safer if she came back.
Anyway, I trust that Mei can protect her.

Escaleras salida.t: I feel the energy of the book around here!
It's obvious that it has go down to another level.
I hope it hasn't gottenn far.
I hope you like it and will be able to finish the game so you can enjoy it completely.

teoria_hiragana.t: Here you will learn to use your powers.
You will learn to use spells as you learn the language of magic.
These symbols are hiragana, and represent sounds. For example "do" in our language is written ど.
Try to memorize them well before continuing, because the book will ask you questions. The more you hit, the more your magic will improve.

teoria_ka_y_ni.t: Look at か (ka) and に (ni). They are not simple sounds, but particles, which have a special use in our language.
か (ka) is placed at the end of the sentences to indicate that the sentence is a question. Later we will see examples.
に (ni) is placed behind a word to indicate an address, among other things.
In many cases the particles are similar to your prepositions.

teoria_palabras_hiragana_kanji_verbos.t: By joining the sounds we have seen we can form words. For example: どこ (doko), which means "where".
But not all words are written in hiragana. Some use kanjis, like 行く (iku) which is the verb "go".
行く ends in く (ku), which is a hiragana that we have already seen. But it starts with a symbol that we do not know: 行, which in this case is read as "i".
If you look at the difference of the symbols in kanji and hiragana, the kanjis are more complex and are mostly made with straight lines.

teoria_radicales.t: Here we have several more kanjis, which are similar.
We start with the simplest ones because they are also used in more complex ones.
These are called radicals, and knowing them helps others learn.
Look, for example, at the "moon" kanji 月 (tsuki), which I will show you later as part of another more complex kanji.

teoria_estructura_frase.t: Now that we know a few words we can start to form sentences.
Look at どこですか. That ends in か tells us that it is a question.
どこ (doko) and です (desu) mean "where" and "to be", so this sentence asks "where is it?".
In Japanese the verbs are put at the end of the sentence, both です (desu) and 行く (iku), which means "go".
Also particles are put after the word or phrase they accompany, both か (ka) and に (ni).
In the case of に (ni), it accompanies そこ (soko) which means there. Literally it says "there to go", or correctly translated: "There it goes".

teoria_diferencias_na_ta.t: Here we have more syllables in hiragana.
I advise you to pay special attention to the difference between な (na) and. た (ta), which are quite similar.
Another interesting symbol is は (ha), which we will see later that it isn't always pronounced that way.

teoria_particula_wa.t: Another important particle is the は (wa) particle.
As you will see it is written as hiragana は (ha), but pronounced "wa". This tells us that it is the main topic particle.
This particle is placed behind a word to indicate that this is the main topic of the phrase.
For example あなたは (anata wa) is like saying: "talking about you" or "about you".

teoria_sufijos.t: Some kanjis are a word for themselves, like 人 (hito - person), 夫 (otto - husband) and 犬 (inu - dog).
Others like 大 (dai - big) are only used as part of other words. Soon we will see some example.

teoria_variación_te_de.t: Look at the new hiragana て (te). Doesn't it look familiar? It's almost like で (of).
Those two small lines that have で and do not have て are called dakuten, and they serve to form voiced consonants.
We will see more examples in the future. I hope that knowing this will help you remember and distinguish these two syllables.

teoria_palabras_complejas_y_radicales.t: Do you remember the kanji 大 (dai - big)? Well, here we have it as part of the word 大丈夫 (daijoubu), which means "to be fine".
Another more complicated word is 名前 (namae - name). The kanjis that form it may seem difficult to remember, but it is not so hard.
To achieve this, look at the radicals that compose them. For example, the bottom part of the first has the radical "mouth": 口 (kuchi).
The second has the radical "moon" on the left. Do you remember it? It's 月 (tsuki), that I showed you before.

diferencias_ra_chi.t: In these hiragana I advise you to look at the difference between ら (ra) and ち (chi).
Although they look alike, in ち (chi) the top line is completely horizontal and cuts the other line.

teoria_hon_ki.t: Here we have another series of kanjis quite similar. Look closely at the differences.
For example, the book kanji (本) is like the tree kanji (木) but with one more line at the bottom.

teoria_watashi_tachi.t: Here we have two new verbs, both finished in る (ru), which is the most common ending for verbs.
Another interesting thing is the word 私たち (watashi tachi) which means "we".
Actually た ち (tachi) is used to convert many words into plural, as we will see later.

teoria_to.t: Another common particle is と (to) that is put behind a name to indicate with whom we perform the action.
It is similar to our preposition "with".

teoria_forma_te_y_nai.t: The verbs we have seen so far were in the so-called "dictionary form", ending in "u", like 来る (kuru).
But if you pay attention here we find the same kanji followed by another hiragana: 来て (kite).
It is a conjugation of 来る (kuru), which is known as -て form (te form), and has many uses that we will soon begin to see.
Notice that the pronunciation of the kanji changes when conjugated: from "ku" it happens to "ki".
This change of pronunciation is not usual: this is an irregular verb.
On the other hand 知らない (shiranai) is in form - ない (nai), which is the negative form of the verb.
知る (shiru) means "to know", while 知らない means "not to know".
In this case, it is usually formed by changing the last syllable to the version with "a" and adding - な い (nai).
That is, in this case る (ru) becomes ら (ra), and we add - ない: 知らない (shiranai).

teoria_pasado_formal_y_doble_consonante.t: Here we have another conjugated verb: 来ました (kimashita).
In Japanese, you can talk more formally or less formally. This is one of the formal cases.
-ました (mashita) is the conjugation that indicates formal past. The る (ru) of the end is replaced by this conjugation.
While 来る (kuru) means "I come", 来ました (kimashita) means "I came".
Also note the expression どうやって (douyatte). Do you see that he has a small つ (tsu) between や (ya) and て (te)?
This little つ (tsu) is called soukuon, and it makes the next consonant have a double sound. In this case やって (yat-te).

teoria_forma_te_kudasai.t: Here we have a first example of using the -て (te) form.
To ask for something politely put ください (kudasai) behind the verb in the -て (te) form.
For example, to ask someone to 'come please', we say 来てください (kite kudasai).

teoria_wo_da.t: を (wo) is another usual particle. We put it behind the object of the sentence on which the verb acts.
Notice also that in this particle the double vee almost doesn't sound. The sound is almost like a simple "o".
We will see an example of its use later.
Also look at the word だ (da), which is the dakuten version of the syllable た (ta).
This word is the informal form of です (desu), and has the same meaning.

teoria_masu.t: Here we have the verb います (imasu), which is the formal conjugation of いる.
This is called the -ます (masu) form, and it is usually enough to substitute the last syllable of the verb for - ます (masu).
So in formal mode we have -ます (masu) for the present and -ました (mashita) for the past.

teoria_te_imasu.t: Another use of the て (-te) form is the expression - て + います (-te imasu), which indicates continuous tense.
Indicates that the action hasn't finished, that you are still doing it.
For example, in this case 知っています (shite imasu) means "to be knowing".

teoria_otros_verbos.t: As I said, this is the dictionary form, which ends in "u".
Look especially at the Kanjis. You can memorize some of them based on their radicals.
思う (omou) has the radicals 田 (ta) and 心 (kokoro), whereas 見る miru has the radical 目 (me), for example.

teoria_imperativo.t: Another use of the -て (te) form is the imperative.
If we use the -て (te) form without putting ください (kudasai) behind, it ceases to be a request and becomes more like an order, in imperative.
For example, 見せて (misete), the -て (te) form of the verb 見せる (miseru), which means "to show", becomes "show me".

teoria_yo.t: Here we have the particle よ (yo), which is placed at the end of the sentence to give expressiveness.
It has several uses, like emphasizing a petition, or the certainty of your affirmation.
Later we will see examples of its use with which I will be able to explain it better.

teoria_tai.t: Another important conjugation is the conjugation たい (tai), which means to want.
If いる (iru) means "to be", when we substitute る (ru) for たい (tai), it means "want to be".

teoria_wo_beki_yo.t: In these expressions we have several examples of what we have explained before.
The particle を (wo) is used after 思い出 (omoide) "memories", to indicate that this is what we want to show.
The word べき (beki), used behind 戻 る (modoru), means "you should go back".
And in that same phrase the particle よ (yo) is used at the end to express that that is something you really believe in.
Finally we also have the word 一緒に (isshoni) and and the conjugation いたい (itai) to express "I want to be with you".
